description: Single storey rear extension following demolition of existing extension, raise roof ridge by 250mm, rear roof extensions, 2 roof lights to the front roof slope and 2 flank windows.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Proposed Plans and Elevations and Site Location Plan.

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the upper floor flank window (second floor, eastern elevation) shall be glazed with obscure glass and fixed shut and shall be permanently maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window, door or other opening shall be installed into the western elevation of the single storey rear extension hereby authorised without planning permission first obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - Access to the flat roofs of any part of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 7 - In accordance with paragraphs 186 and 187 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
